text: Anaphylatoxins <extra_id_0> C5a <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> C3a <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induce nuclear factor kappaB activation in human peripheral blood monocytes .
The anaphylatoxins <extra_id_0> C5a <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> C3a <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> are involved in the regulation of cytokine production .
In this study the capability of <extra_id_0> C5a <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> C3a <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to induce transcription factor activation was examined .

<extra_id_0> C5a <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> C3a <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> stimulation of human peripheral blood monocytes resulted in nuclear expression of a DNA binding activity with specificity to the kappaB sequence .

The <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> proteins , constituents of the prototypic nuclear factor kappaB , were identified as components of the DNA - protein complexes by anti-peptide antibodies in gel supershift assays .

<extra_id_0> C5a <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induced kappaB binding activity was detected 15 min after agonist stimulation , peaked at 30-40 min , and remained detectable at 2 h . Binding to kappaB sequence was accompanied by an initial decrease and subsequent increase in the cytoplasmic <extra_id_0> IkappaBalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> levels , as detected by Western blotting using an anti - <extra_id_0> IkappaBalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> antibody .

text: Pertussis toxin treatment markedly decreased kappaB binding activities induced by both <extra_id_0> C5a <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> C3a <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , whereas cholera toxin displayed no inhibitory effect .
Neither of the two toxins affected kappaB binding activity induced by <extra_id_0> TNFalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in the same cells .

These results imply a potential role of the anaphylatoxins <extra_id_0> C5a <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> C3a <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in regulating leukocytes gene expression through G protein - coupled transcription factor activation .
